¿	Incident Investigation - MPEA Energy Center has updated a site-specific incident investigation procedure that ensures each incident that either results in a release or could have resulted in a release of anhydrous ammonia is investigated, within 48 hours, by a team of at least one person knowledgeable in the process.  This procedure will also make provisions to ensure a report is prepared at the conclusion of the investigation and findings are promptly addressed. 
¿	Compliance Audit - MPEA Energy Center has updated a site-specific compliance audit program that ensures compliance audits are conducted at a minimum of every three years to verify that MPEA Energy Center PSM/RMP practices and procedures are adequate and are being followed.  A compliance audit was completed April 19, 2012, and the next compliance audit will be conducted by April 19, 2015.  
¿	Hot Work Permits - MPEA Energy Center has updated a best management practice for hot work.  Hot work procedures were reviewed during the most recent compliance audit, on April 19, 2012.

VII.	Five-Year Accident History
The MPEA Energy Center has not had an accidental anhydrous ammonia release, which resulted in deaths, injuries, or significant property damage onsite, or known offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage in the last five years.

VIII.	Emergency Response Program
MPEA Energy Center has developed an Emergency Response Plan (ERP) to ensure that in the event of an emergency the facility personnel are aware of the appropriate actions to take and authorities to contact in order to mitigate the effects of a release. 

MPEA Energy Center has communicated and trained facility employees on proper evacuation procedures and has had interaction (i.e. onsite inspections) with the Chicago Fire Department.

MPEA Energy Center has developed an Emergency Response Plan (ERP) that contains procedures designed to maximize the safety of all employees, contractors, and visitors in the event of an emergency and also guard against environmental consequences.

III.	Facility Identification
The MPEA Energy Center is located at 2211 South Martin Luther King Jr. Drive in Chicago, Illinois.  The facility provides steam/heating and chilled water/air conditioning for the Chicago Metropolitan Pier and Exposition Authority's McCormick Place exhibition and Convention Center and surrounding buildings. The NAICS code for the facility is 22133. 

The facility uses ammonia for refrigeration, and is regulated under 40 CFR Part 68, the EPA RMP Rule. There is one recirculating closed-loop refrigeration system onsite. The system contains a charge of 29,000 pounds of ammonia, which is above the minimum threshold quantity of 10,000 pounds.

An aerial map identifying the site location is included as Appendix A.

¿	Training - MPEA Energy Center has updated a site-specific training procedure that ensures employees operating the ammonia process have the knowledge to safely operate the process, are aware of the potential hazards of the process, and understand the causes of process problems.
¿	Management of Change - MPEA Energy Center has updated a site-specific management of change procedure that ensures changes (except for replacement in kind) to the ammonia process, such as additions of new equipment or changes in operating, maintenance, or other procedures are documented. The most recent management of change occurred on March 15, 2013.
¿	Pre-Startup Review - MPEA Energy Center has updated a site-specific pre-startup safety review procedure that ensures a safety review is performed when modifications to the ammonia process are significant enough to require a change in PSI.  The most recent PSSR was conducted on April 10, 2013.
¿	Mechanical Integrity - MPEA Energy Center has updated a site-specific mechanical integrity procedure that ensures written preventative maintenance procedures are developed and maintained, preventative maintenance tests and inspections are properly documented, and employees maintaining the process receive adequate training.  MPEA Energy Center most recently reviewed the preventative maintenance procedures during May 2014.
¿	Contractor Qualifications - MPEA Energy Center has updated a site-specific contractor qualification procedure that ensures all contract employers' safety performance and programs are evaluated, a contract employee injury and illness log is maintained, information of potential hazards are communicated between MPEA Energy Center and the contract employer, and required training and information is communicated, su

with the City of Chicago LEPC and the Chicago Fire Department.  This coordination effort includes providing each aforementioned agency with a copy of our ERP, and providing each with a site diagram and hazardous material information.

MPEA Energy Center's hazardous materials response team will be responsible for investigating and assisting the Chicago Fire Department (if necessary) with response to accidental releases of ammonia. 

Several employees on staff have received HAZWOPER training through classroom instruction, on-the-job training and drills. The current HAZWOPER training includes the first responder awareness level, the first responder operations level, hazardous materials technician, and incident commander training.   

The facility has one (1) windsock on the east side of the facility and four (4) flags present on the west side of the facility for use in determining wind direction in the event of an ammonia release and evacuation of the facility.

The current Material Safety Data Sheet (MSDS) for anhydrous ammonia is included in Appendix E. 

IX.	Emergency Communications
The telephone numbers of agencies and plant personnel that may be contacted in case of an emergency are available onsite.

X.	Planned Changes to Improve Safety
Chemical safety is an important part of MPEA Energy Center operations. MPEA Energy Center recently conducted an audit of their Process Safety Management Program and will be dutifully implementing the recommendations from that audit. Continuous improvement in safety is an important goal for MPEA Energy Center. 

XI.	Management Program
MPEA Energy Center has updated a management system to oversee the implementation of the risk management program elements.  This system has assigned qualified person(s) (or position) to assist in the development, implementation, and integration of the risk management program elements.
